context: To check for possible salivary contamination, α-amylase concentrations in all EBC samples were measured by in vitro colorimetric methods (Roche Diagnostics, Basel, Switzerland; α-Amylase-Liquid BIO-LA-TEST kit, Pliva-Lachema, Czech Republic). In the methodological study, LTB4 concentrations in EBC were expressed as pg/ml. In the observational study performed in children, LTB4 values in EBC were expressed as total amount (in pg) of leukotriene expired in the 15min breath test (LTB4 concentrations×volume of EBC). Concentration of LTB4 in undetectable samples was arbitrarily considered 25pg/ml that corresponds to 50% of the lower limit of quantification (50pg/ml).Sample pre-treatment In the methodological study, 1ml of EBC samples was spiked with 1.5ng/ml LTB4-d4 and concentrated 40-fold under a gentle nitrogen stream without any pre-treatment. Then, 20μl of the concentrate solution were directly injected into the sample loop. In the second study, 10μl of EBC sample were directly injected into the liquid chromatograph with no pre-treatment. In the study aimed at measuring 8-isoprostane in EBC with LC/ESI-MS/MS, EBC samples were pretreated with 50μl of immunoaffinity sorbent for 60min.Analytical conditions 2.6.1 Methodological study The stable isotope dilution method with LTB4-d4 as internal standard was used.
